reviewText: I watched the marathon on ABC Family and this was the gist of the entire experience.  There's very little mention of the actual Lying Game mercifully because it sounds like Cruel Intentions type of demonstrations of teen cruelty.  But what IS interesting is that the childlike face of the lead actress playing both twins does NOT lend credence to there actually being a good poorer twin.  In fact, her ability to see the bright side in her new more comfortable situation may simply mean she is more adept at duplicitousness than her openly aggressive twin who may have learned from childhood disappointments that her adoptive parents are less innocent than their public demeanors.  There MUST be a reason Helen Slater is channeling Lindsay Wagner's unfortunate beige makeup instead of Mrs. Billy Moses' much cuter flintiness and focus.  We'll see.
summary: The ONLY way to win at the Lying Game is to not play at all.
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewText: This is probably the-most AMAZIIING show I've ever seen! After Gossip Girl and Pretty Little Liars, this show is one of the best shows ever! :D
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewText: But unlike other ABC Family dramas, this one falls a little flat. Maybe it is the lead actress who is forced to play two wildly different roles, or the actors cast as the parents who don't quite live up to their believability, but this one isn't as good as the rest of ABC Family's roster.
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewerName: Joseph Kohout Jr. "The Art of War"
reviewText: I heard that an actor who played twins in a soap opera actually got paid for each character.OK, so my excuse is that I watch this show with my daughter =:)  Even the song: "Gun for a Tongue" by Butterfly Boucher draws you in.  Then there is the cast.  Pros like Helen Slater and Adrian Pasdar.  Less not forget my favorite bare mid-drifted hottie from "Angel", Charisma Carpenter!Done in a serial format, this show keeps you wanting more!While the shows are different, "The Lying Game" reminds me of another guilty pleasure, "Hell Cats".  Attractive cast, kicking soundtrack and enough of a plot to keep you tuning in.  The difference being that "The Lying Game" will get a season 2!
summary: Does Alexandra Draw 2-Salaries? A Guilty Pleasure!
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewText: i like this series, but when i stopped watching it i didnt miss it much. then i didnt want to get back to it feeling like i prob missed enough that i wouldnt know what was going on anymore.
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewText: There were two new series of TV shows last season about twins changing places, a common theme from long past. These shows were the Lying Game, for younger adults and teens, and "Ringer". Although both were entertaining, the Lying Game was the best in my opinion. In the Lying Game, the twins do not initially know each other exists because of adoption at birth. They both do not know each other or their birth parents, and begin to wonder when they become teenagers, because the parents do not tell them anything except that their birth mother is dead. Some plot twists in this show is that one twin was adopted by well-off parrents, twin Sutton, while the otheer ends up in the Los Vegas foster home system, Emma, and gos through 12 foster homes, prior to the series commencement.  Sutton starts to look for the twins real mother, but finds Emma first. The twins decide to switch places with Emma taking over Suttons's life, while Sutton continues to look for their birth mother. After the switch, the entertaining hyjinks begin.
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1

reviewText: I love this show and I am waiting with bated breath for this DVD to finally become available for pre order!!I love the books and I'm still waiting to see what happened to Sutton. But the show is so different from the books, yet it's still so fun to watch. It's a completely different story, so I can watch the show and read the books and nothing gets spoiled. Love the whole Emma, Ethan, Sutton, Thayer square that's formed and can't wait to see how things play out in Season 2!
Title: The Lying Game: Season 1
